result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendall S Acoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs, surcharges DNA surcharge as to each count.  DOC to collect from up to 25% of prison funds.  Any remaining balance to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two and any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one and any other sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one, count two and any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendall S Acoff

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order has been electronically sent to DOC

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP; signed and filed. Case forwarded to the Clerk's Office for processing. 

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement
to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the Defendant is assigned shall effect the Defendant's release within SIX (6) working days upon receipt of this Order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 46, Judge Feiss. DJ
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Filed in error, needed to be submitted as an Order directly to the Judge for signature. DJ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (28 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 2, 2015 received and filed.

Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 AND ANY OTHER SENTENCE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
The Court ordered the defendant's operating privileges suspended for 12 MONTHS (CONCURRENT)
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 AND ANY OTHER SENTENCE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
The Court ordered the defendant's operating privileges suspended for 12 MONTHS (CONCURRENT) 
AS TO COUNT 3:The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1, COUNT 2 AND ANY OTHER SENTENCE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders: DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Any remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Any unpaid amount to covert to a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Kendall S Acoff in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Kendall S Acoff in custody.  Karen A. Loebel for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to ALL COUNTS as charged.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing on Monday, November 2, 2015 at 8:30 AM in BR 35, CH Rm 629 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Kendall S Acoff not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests adjournment of plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Kendall S Acoff not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for plea and sentencing today, defendant was not produced from prison.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Kendall S Acoff not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, Defendant Kendall S Acoff not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for Randy P Sitzberger for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendall S Acoff in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Kendall S Acoff in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant Charles Randolph
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kendall S Acoff in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kendall S Acoff in custody.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
 IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
